findings.title: Multiple issues when migrating to new fantiumNFTContractAddress
findings.description: When updating fantiumNFTContractAddress with updateFantiumNFTAddress(), it only changes the address stored but does not affect other scenarios, leading to multiple issues such as minting NFTs with the same tokenId, old allowlist for old collections being active for new collections, and minting on the old contract being frozen.

findings.title: Undefined behavior for `mint`
findings.description: In `FantiumMinterV1.mint()`, param `_to` is intended to be `_to Address to be the minted token's owner`. It's wrong because the final mint will be for `msg.sender`.

findings.title: Insufficient constraint checks
findings.description: Insufficient constraint checks increase the human error probability: a platform manager may enter incorrect data and break the contract logic.
